image.altText: Albanese walks and looks serious on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: Laws to restrict gambling advertising are being bargained over inside Labor's caucus, as the prime minister warns a misstep could have "unintended consequences" for Australia.

title.children: Government bargains to win over Labor MPs on laws to ban gambling ads around children's programs and live sport

image.altText: a skip lowered by a crane

props.synopsis: Investigators will return to the DoubleTree hotel on Cairns Esplanade today as they probe what happened before the allegedly stolen craft crashed.

title.children: Helicopter wreckage removed from roof of Far North Queensland hotel after pilot dies in crash

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a stage

props.synopsis: Once a Democratic stronghold, Wisconsin flipped for Trump in 2016. Now, both Republicans and Democrats are scrambling for votes in America's "dairyland", convinced the 2024 race might be decided there.

title.children: To beat Trump, Harris will likely need this small state. Here's how she and Walz are faring in Wisconsin

image.altText: A professional photo of a man with a beard in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered a probe into nepotism allegations against a senior executive of the Queensland Public Trustee whose son was employed and promoted by the agency.

title.children: Nepotism complaint alleges 'preferential treatment' in hiring of Public Trustee executive's son

image.altText: Crowd of people on the streets of Sydney

props.synopsis: Whatever way you try to split it, the generational divide between millennials and baby boomers is growing — and it's our Australian obsession with owning property that is widening the gap, and interest rates that are keeping it that way.

title.children: Why interest rates and real estate are behind our growing generational divide

image.altText: A man in a checquered shirt holds a heavy hose as another man sprays a large fire

props.synopsis: Greece is on fire watch as high temperatures and dangerous weather conditions fan a dangerous wildfire near the capital.

title.children: Wildfire with flames as high as 25 metres rages near Athens

image.altText: A hand holding a microphone. Foam on top of the microphone has '7 News' on it.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has spoken to more than 200 people to investigate allegations of Channel Seven's toxic culture, uncovering allegations of bullying, sexism, and exploitation.

title.children: 'Brutal culture' at Channel 7 leaves staff suicidal, distressed, and despairing

image.altText: Christine Gwin travelled to Mumbai for dental work

props.synopsis: An Indian dental clinic which markets cut-price services to Australians has been accused of using fake online reviews and price gouging — leaving one woman in pain after she travelled to the subcontinent for care.

title.children: The Australian woman in 'constant pain' after traveling to India for cheaper dental work

image.altText: Marles US UK signing AUKUS document

props.synopsis: A revamped version of the AUKUS agreement includes indemnity for the US and UK against radioactive waste accidents and lets them walk away with one year's notice.

title.children: AUKUS deal would allow US and UK to walk away, with Australia to cover risk of loss or injury

image.altText: A character stands next to a video game depiction of red and yellow post boxes

props.synopsis: Will Australia's next iconic artwork be a game? As the industry matures, a growing suite of Aussie game developers is helping players explore never-before-seen regions and communities … and make some uncomfortable choices.

title.children: Would you recognise your home in a video game? Press A to visit Australia

image.altText: Close up of a hand holding glass under a streaming tap, above a kitchen sink. The glass is full of clear water.

props.synopsis: In April the American environmental protection agency announced there is no safe level of so-called "forever chemicals" in drinking water and set enforceable limits across the country. Australian experts are asking why we're not doing the same.

title.children: 'An international embarrassment': Australia criticised for lagging behind US, EU on drinking water standards

image.altText: Two people enjoy movie with drinks and popcorn.

props.synopsis: There are fewer theatres to visit in the country these days, but operators say they are still pulling in punters.

title.children: Aussies seek cinema escape despite struggling with cost of living

image.altText: Balconies on a hotel apartment building

props.synopsis: The team will review Canberra building designs before construction begins and attend inspections alongside private certifiers to reduce the prevalence of defects in high-rise buildings.

title.children: ACT government to introduce publicly funded building certifiers to reduce high-rise defects

image.altText: Graham Thorpe pictured while coaching for England

props.synopsis: The family of recently-deceased English cricket great Graham Thorpe has revealed he took his own life after a lengthy battle with depression and anxiety despite trying "many, many treatments".

title.children: 'Can affect anyone': Graham Thorpe's wife reveals late English cricket great suffered from depression and anxiety

image.altText: a crowd watches a group play a card game

props.synopsis: A Chinese state-backed newspaper urges people to stop playing a popular card game, arguing it is addictive and distracting people from their work.

title.children: Chinese media denounce card game enjoyed by Communist Party officials

image.altText: Middle aged man in polo shirt sits in front of shipping container with sunset in background

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's two major parties are campaigning hard on crime in the lead-up to the territory election, positioning it as the number one issue at the polls.

title.children: Crime dominates Northern Territory political debate as election looms

image.altText: Bill Shorten: Free to air media 'under attack'

props.synopsis: The federal government will crack down on gambling ads during kids' TV, but frontbencher Bill Shorten says a total ban would punish struggling media companies.

title.children: Media companies need gaming ads, government minister argues

image.altText: A marle statue of three headless female figures, standing nude, side by side, with arms on one another.

props.synopsis: From the influence of the devil to overzealous restorers, there are numerous strange reasons and theories behind the conspicuous lack of pubic hair on women depicted in Western art.

title.children: The nude female body has been depicted in art countless times. But where is all the pubic hair?

image.altText: A lit up taxi sign next to a hand holding phone with Uber sign

props.synopsis: While the taxi industry has taken steps to modernise — including a burgeoning partnership with its main competitors — there are signs it's still grappling to meet the needs of the market.

title.children: 12 years after Uber's arrival, there are signs the taxi industry is still struggling to stay competitive

image.altText: a beach with a rocky cove in the foreground

props.synopsis: Huge swells move tonnes of sand from the northern end of the eastern suburbs beach, but the new feature will only be there for a couple of months according to lifeguards.

title.children: Freshly uncovered cove at Sydney beach attracts visitors, human and seal, but comes with a warning

image.altText: A man and a woman hold up grocery items in front of a yellow truck

props.synopsis: A free grocery store offering an array of produce and pantry staples opens its doors in Adelaide today in a bid to tackle the rising demand for food as the cost of living bites more South Australians.

title.children: 'Care, respect and dignity' as first free supermarket offering 'rescued' items opens in Adelaide

image.altText: An aerial view of a fracking exploration site in the Beetaloo Basin.

props.synopsis: A government-commissioned report on the territory's gas industry, kept hidden from the public for two years, has forecast the NT's emissions could rise up to 150 per cent.

title.children: 'Net zero fantasy': NT government report forecasts new gas projects could cause emissions to double

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears thoughtful, standing at a formal government press conference.

props.synopsis: Victoria's upper house will this week debate a government bill raising the age of criminal responsibility from 10 to 12, but it comes just as community concerns about youth crime are peaking.

title.children: Tragedy throws youth crime debate back under the spotlight in Victoria

image.altText: SA Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia.

props.synopsis: Even as the tide turned for the last SA government, Vincent Tarzia's star remained ascendant. The new SA Liberal leader's political rise began a decade ago, and his career has included stints as speaker and as a minister.

title.children: Who is new SA Opposition Leader Vincent Tarzia?

image.altText: A Rex plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: Administrators for collapsed regional carrier Rex Airlines say a shortage of pilots, supply chain issues and flights not being flown at capacity led to the company accruing more than $500 million in debt.

title.children: Rex administrators blame pilot shortage and supply chain issues for airline's downfall

image.altText: A young man with Down's syndrome in a black t-shirt dances in front of a brick ruin and a grey sky

props.synopsis: When Rewards for the Tribe, a new work performed by a troupe of dancers with and without disability, went on tour, director Rhys Graham was there to document it.

title.children: New Australian dance doco explores what perfection is and whether we should strive for it at all

image.altText: A mid-shot of Linda Reynolds with her husband Robert Reid, arriving at court in Perth.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds's partner tells a defamation trial of the significant deterioration in her health after Brittany Higgins's rape allegation was made public, after an interview on Channel 10's The Project.

title.children: 'We might lose her': Linda Reynolds's partner says senator's health was dire after The Project interview

image.altText: Stacey and Gareth Train YouTube

props.synopsis: A forensic psychiatrist tells an inquest, the trio who killed two police officers and their neighbour on Queensland's Western Downs in 2022, were "morally insane".

title.children: Forensic psychiatrist tells inquest trio who killed two police officers were 'morally insane'

image.altText: Raygun performs at the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: A friend and fellow breaker has leapt to Rachael "Raygun" Gunn's defence after her controversial performance in Paris, but an African American man living in Australia says she appeared to be mocking black culture.

title.children: How did Raygun qualify for the Olympics? Is she really the best Australia has to offer?

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles as an Australian fan takes a selfie, in front of a bunch of other fans

props.synopsis: The Paris Olympics can officially be marked down as a complete success, but it was away from the athletic feats on fields and in pools that real value of the Games could be found.

title.children: What the Paris Olympics taught us about joy, hope and each other

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: The 81-year-old gives his first interview since quitting the race, discussing Donald Trump, the Harris-Walz ticket, and what will be at stake in November.

title.children: Donald Trump 'a genuine danger', says outgoing president Joe Biden in first interview after quitting re-election bid

image.altText: A young woman holding a baby whose face has been blurred. A man sits next to them.

props.synopsis: Crown prosecutor Paul Kerr used his closing statement to call into question Robert and Anne Geeves's account of dropping the missing woman off in Campbelltown, which the lawyer described as a deliberate attempt to throw off detectives.

title.children: Prosecutor accuses couple of 'fabricated lie' in Amber Haigh trial closing statement

image.altText: Relay team

props.synopsis: Australia is always one of the most well-represented countries at the Olympics, boasting a team of 460 athletes this year in Paris. Here is a state-by-state breakdown of the record-breaking team that has taken the Games by storm.

title.children: Australia's team has broken records in Paris — but which states are responsible for the most Olympic gold medals?

image.altText: USMC MV-22 Osprey

props.synopsis: Almost a year since the tragedy, the US Marine Corp has released the findings from an investigation into an Osprey crash in northern Australia that killed three people and injured 20 others.

title.children: US Marines blame 'poor decisions' for Osprey crash that killed three marines in remote NT

image.altText: A group of actors dressed as the Borderland characters stare into the camera

props.synopsis: The adaptation of beloved video game Borderlands has been mired in controversy from the start. Now it's here, can the star-studded cast breathe life into this film?

title.children: Video game adaptations have gotten a lot better, but new film Borderlands sets us back a decade
